{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3324469,"name":"Samuel","username":"Grosssam002","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/df788c/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T15:51:24.703Z","cooked":"

Randomly on our driverstation it disables while driving. When we try to reenable it again the code crashes and we have to restart robot code for it to run again any Ideas what might be causing it. while it’s booting up we get drive module errors but then they disappear after a split second. Here is my link to Github if you want to look through the code
GitHub - Grosssam002/Team-2654-2024-Code
We leave for our first competition tomorrow any help as soon as possible would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks, Code Team 2654

your LEDs and your solenoid are using the same port number in the code. probably one of them doesn’t match where the physical wires are plugged in to the rio.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-05T16:36:36.557Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457371,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-2024-robot-code-crashing-randomly","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-2024-robot-code-crashing-randomly/457371/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3324575,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T16:56:32.460Z","cooked":"
truher:

your LEDs and your solenoid are using the same port number in the code.

That’s generally fine. LEDs (if driven by the rio) use a DIO port, whereas solenoids are usually driven by a port on a PCM or PH.

That said, there is an error related to the LEDs, so something isn’t working correctly. I haven’t had a chance to dig through code yet though

in this case the “solenoid” is a digital output.

For us we had a different problem, but the errors where hidden by the “Internal issue with print and error tags” this is fixed in the latest release of driver station. Try that and check for more errors.

is version 24.0 the latest version for the drivers station?

I believe the issue is your closeleds method, and the fact that you’re closing the m_ledobject, and then trying to use it again in init_leds.

You call m_led.close() at the end of LEDScmd, and then I imagine you start another LEDScmd somewhere, which calls init_leds which tries to send a command to the now closed m_led object

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-03-05T18:43:33.004Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":26,"readers_count":25,"score":10.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457371,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-2024-robot-code-crashing-randomly","display_username":"Samuel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19820,"username":"ArchdukeTim","name":"Tim Winters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57269,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-2024-robot-code-crashing-randomly/457371/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3324783,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T19:23:07.742Z","cooked":"

In general, you should not set up and tear down hardware in individual commands. The subsystem constructor should set up the LED strand, the command should just set the outputs to a pattern, and not initialize or close at all.
